hints: Two strings are anagrams if they have the same characters in different order
What if you sorted the characters of each string? Anagrams would have the same sorted form
Use the sorted string as a dictionary key to group anagrams
Alternative: use a character count tuple as the key for O(n*k) instead of O(n*k*log(k))
explanation: Anagrams have the same characters, just rearranged. If we sort the characters of each string, anagrams will produce the same sorted string. We use this sorted string (as a tuple for hashability) as a dictionary key. All strings that produce the same key are anagrams and get grouped together. Time complexity is O(n * k log k) where n is the number of strings and k is the maximum string length (due to sorting each string).
